page.title: 05Home Life in Yewdale
page.content: Many of the farms in our area are owned by the{National Trust,}and the farmers have secure tenancies, although their way of life can be harsh and demanding. Long hours of work are common, and this affects family life. Families find that free time is at a premium, and much of their coming together as a family is through work, rather than leisure activities, e.g. everyone helps at haytime, gathering and shearing. Even leisure pursuits are often related to farming e.g. following the {Coniston foxhounds.}Wives are often earners of extra income through "bed and breakfast". Although home life in its traditional sense is often limited, these fell families have a unity of purpose which many might envy. Quarrying families have a more regular, but similar life style.
